Collections

Using collections you can create columns each with sticky elements. Due to the collection-parent attribute you can tell the plugin to calculate the stack height of that parent collection and use it as extra offset for itself.

Note

  • This demo also includes a container attribute on the first sticky element. Check out how the header is acting on this.
  • This demo is fully responsive. Perhaps it can inspire you for your own implementation.
Header1 (is sticky to the top but is contained within the "#header")
Adds some space between "header1" and "header2" to see if they will stick together when you scroll down enough
Header2 (should be sticky to the top but underneath "header1" until "header1" moves off the screen. Notice how the sidebar slides under this container up until a certain point, too.)
